message.content:
We only need to look at the initial (“Initial20231231001”) transactions. In this problem the initial entries are as follows:
• Cash deposit: 3000000.0  
• Bank deposit: 5000000.0  
• Fixed Assets: 8000000.0  

The paid‐in capital (or contributed capital) is the sum of these initial cash and asset contributions. That is:  
3000000.0 + 5000000.0 + 8000000.0 = 16000000.0

Since later operating or investment transactions (such as purchases, sales, expenses, etc.) do not affect the paid‐in capital account, the end balance remains the same as the initial contributed amount.

Thus:
Paid-in Capital Initial Value = 16000000.00  
Paid-in Capital End Value = 16000000.00

Below is the answer in the required JSON format.

--------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {"Paid-in Capital Initial Value": "16000000.00", "Paid-in Capital End Value": "16000000.00"}}
